page.title: 03Sor Brook :Banbury
page.content: Sor Brook starts at a weir about half a kilometre north-west of Wykham Lane. It is about {6.4 kilometres long}. It supplies the moat of {Broughton Castle} and then goes under the Tadmarton Road and along to {Wykham Mill}. It then goes under Bloxham Road to a weir where it ends. There are three drains from the moat, they join up make Sor Brook again. There are a few crop fields beside the brook but mostly they are hay and grazing fields. The brook runs in a South-Easterly direction. It ends just south of Wykham Park. It is {three to five metres wide}. The farms it passes are Wykham Mill Farm, Castle Farm, Ells Farm, Fulling Mill Farm and Broughton Grounds Farm. The brook used to power Wykham Mill. The brook finally runs into the {River Cherwell}. Mark Cusiter
